page.title: 01LOCAL HISTORY
page.content: {CIRENCESTER PARK } SIR BENJAMIN BATHURST PURCHASED THE MANORS OF OAKLEY AND SAPPERTON IN 1695. HIS ELDEST SON, ALLEN,SUCCEEDED HIS FATHER IN 1704. QUEEN ANNE CREATED ALLEN AS THE FIRST LORD BATHURST IN 1711. IN 1771 HE RECEIVED AN EARLDOM PARTLY IN RECOGNITION OF HIS SERVICES TO THE THAMES AND SEVEN CANAL COMPANY. {LORD BATHURST}WAS INTERESTED IN LITERATURE AND HAD AMONG HIS FRIENDS SOME OF THE POETS AND PLAYWRIGHTS OF THE DAY:{ADDISON,SWIFT,CONGREVE,GAY, {ROWE AND ESPECIALLY ALEXANDER POPE. THEY WERE ALL FREQUENT VISITORS TO CIRENCESTER. IN 1714 LORD BATHURST BEGAN THE TASK OF REBUILDING HIS HOUSE AND PLANNING CIRENCESTER PARK. POPE HELPED LORD BATHURST IN THE PLANNING AND PLANTING OF THE ESTATE.
